position.marginalia_text: Neo-arthurum: eundemq[ue] Neo-merli[num] et iam tandem Hyperca[e]sarem: id est, Imperatorem, et Cosmopragmaticum incomparabilem. Mack-dei.

marginalia.translation:
I consider the prince of youth: a new Arthur, and also a new Merlin, and now, at last, someone beyond Caesar: That is, an emperor and an imcomparable practical man of the world.
Mack-dei.
A new Arthur, and someone beyond Caesar.

position.marginalia_text: { Plenaria La[e]titia, et Audacia faciunt hominem reiuuenescere; cum viuida Dia[e]ta, et quotidiana Exercitatione in Sole. Sed plenaria semper, et absoluta. Nam dimidiata ista, et vulgaris, parum aut

marginalia.translation: A full happiness and boldness make a man grow young again, together with a vigorous way of living and daily exercise in the sun. But it must be full and absolute. Indeed, if it is halved and vulgar, it is worth little or nothing.

position.marginalia_text: Extraordinaria sunt, et singularia, qua[e] operantur potentum effectum, et admirabilè.

marginalia.translation: Those things which bring about a potent and admirable effect are extraordinary...

position.marginalia_text: - suprà La[e]titiam. Quicquid hominu[m] obstrepuerit: aut facinorum ingruerit: aut calamitatum deniq[ue] obruerit.

marginalia.translation: ... beyond Happiness. Whatever men may have hindered you, misdeeds fallen upon you, or calamities overwhelmed you.
